result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly L McDonald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--$100 Domestic abuse surcharge

--No possession of any dangerous weapon or ammunition

--Court determines that Miss McDonald has not provided a DNA Sample and orders her to report to JESO today to provide such a sample

Arresting Agency: Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelly L McDonald

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:03 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Kelly L McDonald in court with Attorney Michael Yang. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock confirms victim rights compliance, no request to be heard at today's hearing. Court so finds Chapter 950 compliance

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1, further prosecution is barred and jeopardy attaches

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on probation for 1 year, with conditions as adopted in the criminal case settlement form, which include:
--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--No possession of any dangerous weapon or ammunition
--Complete certified Batterers' Intervention programming
--No acts or threats of violence
--Fine and/or costs
--$100 Domestic abuse surcharge
--Other costs/fees
--$200 DNA Surcharge
--$243 statutory costs
--Court determines that Miss McDonald has not provided a DNA Sample and orders her to report to JESO today to provide such a sample

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 1:21 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Case called at 9:48am [mo]
Attorney Michael Yang in court.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

The Court indicates that it was presented prior to the hearing an Authorization to Appear.
The Court indicates that this Court requires Defendant's to appear at Status Conference
Atty. Yang requests a Plea/Sentencing hearing.

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess:9:59am

Case called at 11:40 am [sf]
Defendant Kelly L McDonald in court. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies DOB and address.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered on the defendant's behalf; Court preserves the defendant's rights to speedy and substitution of Judge for the next 10 days.

Court continues $250.00 CASH bond, with additional conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Camrin McDonald

Court orders the remiander of the bond be returned to the surety.

recess: 11:44 am
